title: Financial advisor with a big heart gives haircuts for only RM2
text:
MUAR: A freelance financial advisor is using his skills to help the less fortunate by charging only RM2 per haircut.
Muhammad Hafidz Ahmad, 29, said he wanted to do something useful with his time and give back to the community while waiting to get a permanent job.
He said he learnt how to cut hair through watching YouTube videos.
Muhammad Hafidz started out by cutting his friends’ and siblings hair to earn pocket money.
“Being a barber has given me an additional source of income
“I didn’t want to waste my skills and I also wanted to help those in need at the same time,” said the diploma holder.
Among those he is targeting for the cheap haircuts are the elderly and sick who find it difficult to go out.
Muhammad Hafidz said offering RM2 haircuts was also a marketing strategy to establish his name and attract customers.
“I can cut hair anywhere there is electricity. 
“Usually, my customers will ask me to go to their house and gather other family members.
“I can earn up to RM700 per month as most people will give more than RM2,” he added.
Among the hair styles he can do are mid fade, uppercut, lower cut, pompadour.
It usually costs between RM10 to RM25 to get a haircut at a regular barber.
He started offering the door to door haircut service in September last year.
Muhammad Osman Abdullah, 22, said he had no qualms about getting a haircut for RM2.
